title: Normal Draft test coming to Oceania
body:
Hi Summoners,

~~~
**TL;DR**
We are running a Normal Draft test 
Normal Draft will be turned on from 6pm to 11pm AEST (AEDT from 1st October), Thursday to Sunday between 21/09/17 – 19/10/17
~~~
https://i.imgur.com/S6Y3cSn.png

We are committed to providing the best experience to OCE players we can. We know a lot of players have wanted an alternate normal experience from Blind Pick where it is possible to  select your preferred roles and ban your most hated match ups (bye bye Yasuo, Zed, Blitz, Darius) without having to put your LP on the line or competing in a “fastest fingers first” duel to secure your role.

To date, we have held back from enabling Normal Draft on the OCE servers due to our server size and the effects that an additional queue would have on queue times, autofill rates and overall usage. However we think with recent improvements in champ select speed and experience plus matchmaking improvements we can give players an opportunity to test Normal Draft and see if it is a viable option in Oceania.

We will be running a limited test in Oceania for one month to gauge interest and see how Normal Draft works on our server. We will be keeping an eye on the health of Normal Draft queue as well as how it affects the other queues we already have enabled.

We will be looking at queue times, auto fill rates, dodge rates and overall usage to determine how viable Normal Draft is for OCE. We will be providing an update half way into the test period and also a recap of how it went at the end of the test period.

We will be enabling Normal Draft on the OCE server **between 21/09/2017 – 19/10/2017**. During this period, it will be live from **Thursday to Sunday**, **between 6pm – 11pm AEST (AEDT from 1st October)**. It will also be the default selected queue (instead of Blind Pick) when it is enabled.

We hope that you all take this opportunity to experience the queue and also show us which you prefer (by playing Blind or Draft). Thank you for your continued support and good luck on the Rift!

replies.body:
jim: Top!
tony: Top
jim: i got top soz m8 
*tony instalocks jarven  with tp" 
jim: wtf!??!

never again will he have to deal with this problem :D 
{{sticker:galio-happy}}

*Jim gets queued as top*
Tony: give me top
Jim: I want top soz m8
*Tony instalocks Yasuo with tp*
Jim: ...

{{sticker:sg-lux-2}}

IM SO PROUD TO BE AN OCESTER :D

WE get emotes and honour system first and now we get Normal draft :D

I'm SUPPPER excited !!!

Looking forward to some co-ordinated and toxic free champ selects :P

I kind of think he's being sarcastic. If you're not being sarcastic, then I'd just like to chime in that if not for my brother wanting to play with me on OCE I would have defected to NA in a heartbeat any day of the week, and taken an average ping of 200+ _just to play normal drafts that they have had for years_. Oh and also the issue that I can no longer transfer regions with IP and I'd have to dish out a real $15 just to move servers.

Getting on to play the game with a hope to play certain characters only to have it all rely on the luck of being able to type a role in chat the fastest is miserable. Getting on to play and having Yasuo, Lee Sin, Zed, and/or whatever champion is broken at the moment in every single matchup is miserable. Getting on to play ranked queue to forego the two previous issues and eating all the abuse you'd get for just wanting to have some fun is both miserable and unfair to people trying to play seriously. This announcement makes me very happy, but not really proud to belong to OCE.
HA HA you dont know bud ;)

THANK YOU SO MUCH! OMG JUST PLEASE I WANT THIS TO BE MORE THEN JUST A TEST!!! 

{{sticker:sg-lux}}

HOLY SHIT WHAT, RIOT ACTUALLY LISTENED TO THE COMMUNITY??? 

VOICE CHAT NEXT??
https://imgur.com/4Uxsmmi

> VOICE CHAT NEXT??

No thanks.

That's cool, you don't have it use it, it will greatly improve teamwork, but if you want to make your climb to higher elo harder then by all means go ahead. You're probably thinking the same stupid bullshit like the rest of them "I don't want to listen to toxic peoplel" read my above comment and rethink your opinion.

My problem with voice chat isn't the toxicity, like you say there are ways to avoid that.

My problem with it, is that not everyone can game in a space where they can use voice chat.
Which means if you play ranked, you are putting yourself at a disadvantage because the enemy will be using voice chat and you wont be.

Text chat isn't ideal, but it puts everyone on a even playing field.
Voice chat requires you have your own seperate space to play, and many people don't have that, they could be playing from Uni, or from the family computer or from a library/internet cafe. 

So all it does it make the people with their own equipment and room have an advantage, and everyone else a disadvantage.

But that doesn't matter because the same would apply to Overwatch and CSGO, and even then if people aren't in the right environment to talk they can still join the room and listen in on what everyone is saying. I play both of those games and half the players don't use voice chat, but in Overwatch everyone always joins the voice channel so no one is really that disadvantaged.

If you look at it, League is really the game at a disadvantage because it's one of the few massive online games that DOESNT have voice chat.

We are also behind DotA in that respect, but don't try and put logic to it, that's not how this fight goes.

Because you know, me having a mouse is an unfair advantage, people play the game on the track pad of a laptop you know.

And playing with hands is an unfair advantage as well don't forget

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WBKlzLMj7zY
Not sure what your argument is here, all I'm saying is that voice chat is beneficial to the game and people who don't like it can adjust to it fairly.

My point is the people trying to say no to voice chat have poor arguments that are easily countered, but hold their stance because of stupid reasons, sorry, i guess my sarcasm wasn't all that obvious.

Dear Yasuo players, particularly Yasuo mains, who play Normal Draft OCE or ranked with me.

https://uploads.disquscdn.com/images/cea048690595d336a18d72f41a113d5800e0328da7fea5dbe35786e046a07fb8.gif

Is this available to everyone, or are pre-30s excluded?

Also, thank you Riot <3

It will be available to players pre 30 as well. But I believe there will be a couple of requirements. 

You need to be level 10 and have at least 20 champions.

I believe draft level requirement is to give time for new players to get used to playing the game a bit before being thrown into bans, roles, getting your champion picked etc.

As for the 20 champion restriction its there because you need atleast 20 champions so there is 0 chance that ALL your champions are banned or picked away from you. Free to play rotation is included in this 20 so thats 14 taken care you just need to make sure you have 6 more.

Hope that makes sense.
I assumed the level requirement of 10 would be because of smite, in case of autofill.

Thank you so much... you have no idea how much this means to all of us in OCE...

It's reassuring to know that Riot is aware of OCE's existence.

You know we have an office in Sydney with Rioters dedicated to serving the Oce player right =P

OCE servers, Oceanic Pro League (OCS,OOL as well), Ocean Week, High School program, University program and community support among other things are what we do here in the Oceanic office. =D 

Always here listening, chatting and trying to do whats best for our game and community.
You weren't listening when OCE players were asking why you took normal draft away in the first place. You gave them that abomination, flex, instead.

Hi Heretic, I'm sorry we gave that impression, but the reason for Normal Draft's removal in OCE was simple and thoroughly explained back when I had the uneasy task of telling players it was being removed.

The old Normal Draft should have worked in OCE. OCE had enough players to sustain it here and for a while it did work.
But for some reason it saw a continually declining number of players, a decline that showed no signs of stopping. Players in OCE just slowly drifted away from the queue and over to Blind Pick.

We could have left it on a little bit longer as at the average MMR queue times were acceptable. But outside of that range and surely creeping into that range of average MMR, queue times and matchmaking quality was suffering and getting worse.
This was back when we didn't have the ability or resources to confidently make changes to queue times locally and we just weren't confident it was even going to sustain itself as a limited time queue. So rather than move it to a restricted time slot like TT, it was removed.

We're just as hopeful as most that this test of Normal Draft goes well and we can keep it on a schedule similar to or better than this test.

[It's about fucking time.](https://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-strategy/Ml9uMfoA-can-we-replace-blind-pick-with-no-bans-normal-draft)

I have no idea why we were forced into a position where we had a choice between have games ruined by shitty comps/hard counters/mirror lanes (all of the downsides of Blind Pick), or playing Ranked.

Cos draft pick totally takes away people's shitty computers?
And draft pick encourages hard counters _(thats the whole point of seeing what the enemy picks)_.

Im afraid I don't understand.

1. But they don't call in the Lobby - they select role beforehand.
2. But you get to alter your runes and masteries to mitigate how shit the lane is.

> [{quoted}](name=Maraudaur,realm=OCE,application-id=3fteLeTW,discussion-id=WEAy3U0l,comment-id=,timestamp=2017-09-18T05:49:47.801+0000)

> To date, we have held back from enabling Normal Draft on the OCE servers due to our server size and the effects that an additional queue would have on queue times, autofill rates and overall usage. However we think with recent improvements in champ select speed and experience plus matchmaking improvements we can give players an opportunity to test Normal Draft and see if it is a viable option in Oceania.

I mean he literally says why

One of the many frustrations of being on the oce server :/ As a community we are always last and still waiting for these game modes to transfer over, what has it been more than 4 years and still no 3v3 ranked? and now they're bringing out normal draft before that. For a game so large and one that i really enjoy for that matter, i wish i felt like there was actually a community to be apart of, even more so when it comes to riot and their communications with their player base, it'd be nice to feel like we as players could contribute/give feedback to help. (This isn't just about 3v3 ranked either, its more than that) this probably isn't the forum to try and reach out to you guys on, but then again my point is pretty clear on the fact that who even knows where that may be? Sincerely wishing i knew right now.

Ranked 3v3 was actually added several months ago, though is currently only available on Thursday and Friday evenings/nights (between 5pm and 12am). That said, I think it's fair to say that Riot has left most "standard" queues alone for far too long before even giving them a chance on OCE, let alone before actually giving them *some* consistent up-time (and ranked 3v3 has been no exception).

I didn't even realise, i thought only normal 3v3 had a designated time on oce.  None the less it would be nice to really be able to connect with the lol community/ riot in someway that could benefit all parties, if that is even possible ion the future.

I wholeheartedly agree. We in Riot OCE could be doing more to just listen and exchange feedback with players. What do you think would be a good platform for that? I'm taking notes ;)

Also AAAAGH Ranked Flex TT has been on Thur/Fri nights since December 2016! I get it though, it's actually not obvious because the queue select screen doesn't specify it's Ranked TT until you select the queue and start a lobby. Unfortunately there's no way to make it display more info on that initial screen :(

Thank you for the response. Honestly i feel like discord IS the most optimal platform for any gaming community when it comes to enabling fluent and filterable chat rooms. Being able to view everyone's personal and collective opinions, ideas and positive input, as well as being able to filter who is able to participate within the chat room i believe is a HUGE factor in having  positive and constructive feedback.

My thoughts on having multiple chat rooms including  filterable chat rooms opposed to something like the league forums where everybody can participate.
Of course i want to bring the community together, but lets be honest, i dont know how many situations ive seen on these forums where a rioter/ member of our community has made a post about a current subject (x) within the game, and the topic has been completely flooded with people who are clearly only here to complain about things that they find irritating about subject (x) rather than reaching out and trying to communicate ideas and functions that could possible benefit both sides of the coin.

Topic at hand - Rooms where everybody in the community can read riot employee proposals as well as where rioters can instantly grasp a large community known problem/topic that is non biased is what we as a community need.
1. We could have some rooms were Riot gets the floor and simply lays down what you guys have planned or are excited to share with us.
2. Rooms where ONLY lower tier players can ask for assistance, where they can get feedback from people in order to assist their efforts in a certain area, this also would be a good way to deny people throwing shade towards them, being passionate about the game shouldnt be frowned upon even when that person may be speaking on bias/incorrect terms, simply it means they just need their own designated place to feel like they are not always just complaining without getting anything in return. 
3. Rooms where People of a higher understanding/ tier can reach out to riot, This would provide a place where You guys at riot can reach out and ask some of the people who really put their heart and soul into the game how they feel our recent efforts have been, and what we think could be a good place to start in order to improve/adjust parts of the game/community IF anything needs ot be addressed at the time.
4. Casual players- This is something i really want to touch base on, we need a place where you guys can talk to people  who dont care about winning or losing, players who dont care about grinding out ranked games and mastering one champion to the max or becoming a 'god' on multiple champs. Casual players can offer a lot of unbiased answers, they don't care about whats hurting them in their non existent ranked games or why said champion is over powered because of reasons A through to Z. Casual players see what they don't like and also what they like, however they dont really mind if it stays the same or not because they're just here to smash out some norms with their squad, and that is awesome.

5.Discords platform for me at least feels a lot more fluent than the LoL Forums, I think it would be a great place to host rooms for players who are seeking another team to go up against, looking for spare players to queue up with or somebody who mains a champion that they want to pick up. Being able to receive/respond to feedback upon instant notification is something that the community would greatly benefit from.


We are the smaller community, but that doesnt mean we cannot make this work. I believe that if we really put in the work and effort to create something where we can all connect easier, we would resolve alot of the problems that come with areas that we feel can only be controlled by chance (ranked 3v3s for example, of course this isn't my main priority though). I dont think our size in comparison to servers like NA or EU should really control what we can or cant do/achieve on our server as a community. 

PS. Inb4 dire wolves reverse sweep c9

The Dream

Thanks for responding again, Hope my points kept you interested rather than becoming a boring read.

Not at all boring to read. You bring some good ideas to the table in how to get the most out of a platform like Discord for this purpose.
I agree that the size of our server shouldn't be an issue here. If anything it allows the sense of community to become stronger as individuals, as we can all engage with a higher percentage of the total community than we'd be able to on a much larger server.

I'll record these ideas and our team will revise them when we consider how to best improve our level of engagement among our fellow players.
Something like this is on our backlog, next is deciding how to prioritize it, when we can get started, and how to work it into something that can be recurring.

PS. If Dire Wolves beat C9 once, I'll be happy. If they finish top of group I'll be ecstatic, if they make it past the play-in stage I don't know if I'll be able to contain myself.
HUGE fan of this decision
YES{{sticker:sg-lux}}
Can we maybe have it turn on just a little earlier for us east of Australia? :3

We definitely want to expand the queue time frames to accommodate as many players as we can. But for the initial test we picked 6pm - 11pm AEST to give it the best shot possible of being successful =D 

Hopefully in future we can expand the queue so its even better for fellow players east of Australia (I am a proud Kiwi player).

If the trial is successful will the operating hours of normal draft be extended? I have stopped playing league for the most part due to how bad I find the blind pick experience to be but the operating hours of the draft pick trial aren't accessible for me. Id love to come back if to the game if there was a non ranked non blind mode I could access.
its definitely on the table. First we want to ensure it is healthy during the existing window and if it is we will explore options to expand the times.
Good to know, thanks for the response!
tysm{{sticker:sg-ahri-2}}

There's always a possibility that Ranked Flex TT players could choose to play draft SR some days, especially during the test period if they want to show their support for the mode.
But based on some research we did back when investigating if we could test the old Ranked Teams TT queue on OCE (before Ranked Flex TT was a thing), we believe that anyone who is playing Ranked Flex TT these days is likely to prefer TT over SR if they had to choose between the two.
Therefore while there may be some impact, we don't predict that it will significantly impact TT in the long run. But this is just a prediction and anything could happen.

Additionally, the TT queues may currently be impacted by the fact that you have to log out and log back in to play TT when it turns on. This is something we're pushing to get fixed.

Alright sounds good. Hopefully the overlap doesn't cause many issues. 

> [{quoted}](name=Gehirn,realm=OCE,application-id=3fteLeTW,discussion-id=WEAy3U0l,comment-id=000d0000,timestamp=2017-09-18T12:41:26.268+0000)

> Additionally, the TT queues may currently be impacted by the fact that you have to log out and log back in to play TT when it turns on. This is something we're pushing to get fixed.

Sweet, I thought my client was bugged or something. Makes more sense now.

While I'm here, is there any chance I can ask about the new ban situation in 3v3?
Currently Taric is a must ban on red side. This wasn't so bad with the old ban system but now a player has to give up their own ban for Taric otherwise the game will result in a dodge (happens every week). It's comparable to when Camille Rengar and LB were permaban status in competitive. It feels pretty bad. 
Any thoughts?

My thoughts on this are that the aim is to give each player 1 ban similar to SR, and as there are fewer players in TT games it reduces the possibility that a large amount of bans can be thrown at any single player in high elo where everyone generally knows who is who in a small pool of players. But that's just my assumption.
I'll see if I can dig up an actual reason given by the team managing the mode as to why we don't move it to 10 bans like SR.

Hey thanks for the response on this. 
You aren't wrong about the target banning either. It happens quite a lot up here. 

Things tend to get a bit complicated when there's a bunch of pick / ban tier champions on any given patch (4 S tier mages, 3 S tier supports and 3 S tier carries come to mind immediately). 10 bans would be fantastic but I have no idea how this will affect champ select or even function (who will get more bans if there is 3 people per team?).

I also do believe having a more flexible pool is best in 3v3. Once players get recognized in higher tiers, the target bans flow through and if you're an OTP or similar you have a bad time.

No problem.

It does appear that our main priority with the ban system in TT was to just move it to be 1 ban per player, rather than increase the amount of bans to be in line with SR.
You raise an important point with ban distribution. This and other factors & unknowns about how 10 bans will affect TT makes increasing the ban limit a bit more complicated than just flipping a switch, as I don't think the team is comfortable making that change without a concerted effort to understand the goals of the change and the full scope of the expected impact. As such I don't believe the team managing these systems is keen to prioritize working on this change, when they've got a full backlog of other stuff to work on for the rest of the game.
Probably not the answer you wanted to hear, but it's the best info I could get.
